message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with computational aspects of a geometric problem involving point sets and convex hulls, which suggests that it belongs to the computational geometry (cs.CG) sub-category. The use of approximation algorithms and the study of complexity classes also suggest that it could belong to the algorithms and data structures (cs.DS) and discrete mathematics (cs.DM) sub-categories. The problem also involves color classes and the concept of colorful choices, which suggests that it could belong to the combinatorics (cs.CC) sub-category. Finally, the study of the Nearest Colorful Polytope problem and its complexity suggests that it could belong to the game theory (cs.GT) sub-category.
